item.title: Elite sportswomen have shared their stories, and these are the hard truths
item.description: Low pay, discrimination, disordered eating, sexism and online abuse are just a few of the prevalent issues ABC's Elite Athletes in Women's Sport Survey has revealed, despite recent progress in women's sport.

item.title: ABC Elite Athletes in Australian Women's Sport Survey: Results summary
item.description: Here is a summary of the results from ABC Sport's inaugural Elite Athletes in Australian Women's Sport Survey, in partnership with Deakin University.

item.title: Aryna Sabalenka is the woman to beat at Australian Open, showing even more versatility to her game
item.description: Aryna Sabalenka has won yet another title on Australian soil, showing that the Australian Open is hers for the taking.

item.title: In a rare interview, the Taliban's chief spokesman exposes the gap between narrative and reality
item.description: The Taliban's chief spokesman agreed to an unscripted, sit-down interview with me, there was just one non-negotiable condition, writes Meghna Bali.

item.title: The Sydney suburbs saying no to fast food giants in the name of 'heart and character'
item.description: Nutrition, vibe and culture concerns fuel these communities that want to protect their suburbs' identity and businesses from the fast food giants.

item.title: Victorian fires: Twelve major fires still burning as number of buildings destroyed climbs
item.description: Firefighters continue to battle fires across the state after the grim news that a person had been found dead and at least 400,000 hectares burnt. Look back at our live coverage.

item.title: Campus Life program helping young people with disabilities transition after school
item.description: A Brisbane mum was worried about what her son would do after high school, so she created a transition program to help other neurodivergent young adults.

item.title: Supporting your child when starting child care or kindy
item.description: It's natural to feel nervous about transitioning your baby or child into early childhood education. Knowing some settling techniques, as well as what you can advocate for on behalf of your child, can help their transition.

item.title: Summer festival-goers continue to abandon truckloads of camping gear
item.description: With campsite trash accounting for more than half of the rubbish accumulated at music festivals, there are calls for a "cultural shift" in the behaviour of those attending.

item.title: Flood emergency warning for Clermont in central Queensland as ex-Cyclone Koji moves inland
item.description: Authorities have issued a Flood Emergency Warning for the central Queensland town of Clermont as large parts of the state are on flood watch in the wake of ex-Tropical Cyclone Koji.

item.title: National bulk-billing rates are increasing, according to Cleanbill report
item.description: The percentage of GP clinics fully bulk-billing has almost doubled, according to a new report, however, the government says the data cannot be relied on.

item.title: National domestic violence commissioner, legal services say Katherine court unsafe for women
item.description: Australia's domestic violence commissioner and local legal services have raised concerns about women's safety at Katherine Local Court, saying urgent upgrades are needed to protect victim-survivors.

item.title: High hopes for endangered white-throated snapping turtle after record number of clutches
item.description: A record number of clutches of white-throated snapping turtles have been found along the Burnett River in Queensland's Bundaberg region.

item.title: 'Extraordinary' number of clutches
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: WA health report card exposes where the state is struggling most
item.description: The latest WA Health and Wellbeing report reveals how regions stack up when it comes to things like diet, smoking, exercise and mental health.

item.title: Alex Carey comforts daughter, top scores for Adelaide Strikers in BBL return loss to Perth Scorchers
item.description: After a sensational Ashes series, Alex Carey returns to Adelaide and the Big Bash with a bang, although it was a tougher night out for his daughter, Clementine.

item.title: Golden Globes 2026 updates: Rose Byrne wins first Globe, One Battle After Another and Adolescence win big
item.description: Australian actor Rose Byrne wins a Golden Globe for her performance in If I Had Legs I'd Kick You, while Jacob Elordi, Sarah Snook and Joel Edgerton miss out.

item.title: Bushfires leave trail of destruction in northern Victoria town
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Report reveals Bunbury port authority's failure to protect historic Leschenault Homestead
item.description: A report obtained by the ABC under Freedom of Information shows a port authority not only failed to prevent a heritage-listed building from deteriorating, but likely made things worse.

item.title: NSW Police Inspector Amy Scott, praised for Bondi Junction stabbing response, diagnosed with breast cancer
item.description: NSW Police Inspector Amy Scott, who was praised for bringing the Westfield Bondi Junction stabbing attack to an end, has been diagnosed with a rare and aggressive form of breast cancer.

item.title: US federal prosecutors open criminal inquiry into US Federal Reserve chair
item.description: The US attorney's office in the District of Columbia has opened a criminal investigation into Jerome Powell, the chair of the Federal Reserve.

item.title: Golden Globes 2026 winners list: Owen Cooper, Stephen Graham win for Adolescence performances
item.description: Here is the full winners list from the Golden Globes, where Adolescence sweeps all categories and the Pitt wins best drama series.

item.title: Iran's mass protests are not just about a repressive theocratic regime
item.description: Understanding how events unfold in Iran requires understanding how its society and economy have reconfigured in the 47 years since the Islamic revolution.

item.title: How I have fun with friends without spending money
item.description: I've kept low-cost, high-fun habits alive for years, even after returning home to a city where socialising often seems to mean shelling out.

item.title: Rose Byrne wins best comedy nod for If I Had Legs I'd Kick You, and other key moments from the Golden Globes
item.description: This year's Golden Globes saw hits and misses for Australia, last-minute snubs and a humbled Timothée Chalamet.

item.title: Federal minister backs decision to axe Palestinian author from Adelaide writers' festival
item.description: Resources Minister Madeleine King's comments come amid a growing furore over the decision that has led several board members to resign and dozens of writers to withdraw from the Adelaide literary event.

item.title: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese recalls parliament to introduce hate speech and gun laws
item.description: Anthony Albanese has recalled parliament early to deal with sweeping hate speech and gun laws in the wake of the Bondi terror attack.

item.title: Herbal remedy ArmaForce causes severe reaction for Perth woman
item.description: A popular supplement linked to hundreds of adverse events is again in the spotlight after a Perth woman was hospitalised after taking over-the-counter herbal remedy ArmaForce.

item.title: Families wail beside bodies in Tehran as protests continue
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Explosives used to demolish Bell Bay power station smokestack
item.description: It took just 41 kilograms of explosives and less than a minute — a remnant of the 1970s fossil fuel age is blown to bits to make way for a methanol fuel plant.

item.title: Where to get financial assistance following Victorian 2026 bushfires
item.description: A $15 million recovery package to help Victorians begin the massive clean-up process is the latest round of bushfire funding announced by the state government.

item.title: Future of Adelaide Writers' Week 'hangs in the balance' following removal of Randa Abdel-Fattah
item.description: The future of Adelaide Writers' Week (AWW) remains unclear as Palestinian Australian author Randa Abdel-Fattah says she is considering her legal options. Former New Zealand prime minister Jacinda Ardern is among those who will no longer appear at the event.

item.title: Labor pledges fertility treatment rebates as SA state election nears
item.description: Families will be able to access fertility treatment rebates of up to $2,000 per cycle for two cycles, under a Labor promise announced ahead of the upcoming state election.

item.title: Why are people protesting in Iran? Mass anti-government demonstrations continue
item.description: Thousands of Iranians have taken to the streets for more than a fortnight in protests against the country's government. Here's what to know about the situation.

item.title: Max Hobson identified as cattle farmer who died in Longwood fire near Seymour
item.description: Max Hobson has been identified as the person whose body was found metres from a car following the Longwood bushfire.

item.title: Health expert says 'it's a mystery' why WA is falling behind eastern states on illegal tobacco laws
item.description: An eastern states public health expert says "it's a mystery" why Western Australia is lagging behind the rest of the country on updating its illicit tobacco laws.

item.title: Monday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Couple heartbroken after new Harcourt home destroyed by Ravenswood fire
item.description: The couple was supposed to spend their first official night in the new home on Friday. It was destroyed by an out-of-control grassfire that afternoon.

item.title: NT government rejects Albanese's national gun buyback scheme over co-funding proposal
item.description: The Northern Territory government says it does not support the Commonwealth's proposed national gun buyback scheme, stating the territory should not have to share the cost 50:50.

item.title: Iran claims mass protests 'under total control' as human rights group says death toll has reached 648
item.description: Iran claims weeks of anti-government protests across the country have subsided, blaming the US and Israel for the violence.

item.description: Some residents have returned home to take stock of the devastation. Meanwhile, authorities believe the Longwood fire was sparked by a trailer throwing sparks on the Hume Freeway

item.title: Daria Kasatkina and Thanasi Kokkinakis both advance after first round of Adelaide International
item.description: Daria Kasatkina defeated Greek wildcard Maria Sakkari in straight sets 7-6 (7-2) 6-4 on Monday, while Thanasi Kokkinakis beat American Sebastian Korda.

item.title: The Gambia alleges Myanmar undertook a genocidal campaign against the Rohingya people at ICJ
item.description: The case is being watched closely to see how the court might handle other genocide allegations against Israel.

item.title: Locals devastated as coolstore cooperative destroyed by Harcourt fire
item.description: More than 90 businesses used the coolstore in the central Victorian town of Harcourt to store wine, beer, apples, and other produce. Now it's gone.

item.title: Greenland rejects American takeover 'under any circumstance'
item.description: NATO allies are now scrambling to discuss beefing up Arctic security in the hope it deflects Donald Trump away from his intensifying rhetoric towards the island territory.

item.title: Geography quiz: How well do you know this wide, brown land?
item.description: How well do you know this wide, brown land?

item.title: First Venezuela, then the US Fed — what the White House attacks mean for us
item.description: In the past week, the US has dramatically expanded and accelerated its attacks both inside and outside its borders. Here's where Australia stands in the fray.

item.title: Japan's journey from unlicensed 'baby hotels' to delivering restaurant-quality childcare food
item.description: While Australia grapples with childcare scandals, Japan is delivering top-quality care with professional chefs serving up nutritious food. So how did they do it?

item.title: Elite female athletes speak out about struggles with body image and disordered eating
item.description: Throughout her career, former ice dancer Matilda Friend struggled with disordered eating and felt pressure to look a certain way. ABC's Women's Sport survey shows she isn't the only one.

item.title: Where to watch the Golden Globe winners, including One Battle After Another, Adolescence and Hamnet
item.description: The Golden Globes might be over but there are plenty of award-winning films and television to get caught up on.

item.title: Adelaide Writers' Week is in disarray — how did it reach this point?
item.description: The exclusion of novelist and academic Randa Abdel-Fattah from the upcoming Adelaide Writers' Week has prompted significant fallout in the form of withdrawals by other authors. Here's a look at how the events have unfolded, and how they could continue to.

item.title: Alyssa Healy retiring from all cricket after upcoming series against India
item.description: Australia captain Alyssa Healy announces she will retire from all forms of cricket after a multi-format series against India in February and March.

item.title: Details of Labor's new hate speech and gun laws revealed
item.description: Directly quoting from a religious text for the purpose of teaching or discussion may provide a defence under the federal government's hate speech laws proposed in the wake of the Bondi terror attack.

item.title: How the Iranian regime uses the dead in its intimidation and propaganda machine
item.description: As images of rows and rows of dead bodies at a morgue in Tehran circulate, the regime is accused of making it impossible for families to grieve.

item.title: Waiting game for NSW border town as Victorian bushfires burn
item.description: A town in the NSW Snowy Mountains is housing evacuees seeking refuge from the Victorian bushfires.

item.title: Graziers call for action as government and Bureau of Meteorology point fingers over faulty rain gauges
item.description: Graziers say it was "back to the old days" as under-resourced rain gauges failed in north-west Queensland, with the widespread floods killing almost 50,000 cattle.

item.title: Thousands of ACT childcare documents show behind the scenes of embattled industry
item.description: Never-before-seen documents reveal reports of sexual abuse, inappropriate educator discipline, and children missing from ACT childcare centres.

item.title: Fears fish protection measures could threaten Eden Creek Weir platypus population
item.description: Landholders living alongside a northern NSW creek say a government plan to demolish a weir to improve fish migration will be devastating for the local platypus population.

item.title: 179 homes among 500 structures lost with major fires still raging — as it happened
item.description: Victorian fire authorities are worried about worsening conditions as they grapple with major fires across the state, with almost 180 homes lost already.

item.title: Clean-up begins for Clermont as ex-Cyclone Koji moves west
item.description: A clean-up is under way at Clermont, which remains cut-off by floodwaters, as already-saturated western communities are being warned of possible heavy rains.

item.title: Kevin Rudd to resign a year early as Australian ambassador to the US
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says it was Kevin Rudd's own decision to resign from the role on March 31, a year earlier than planned.

item.title: Satirical erotic newspaper discovered inside heritage Hobart hotel
item.description: A satirical and erotic newspaper from the 70s has been uncovered in a heritage-listed Hobart hotel. It shines a light on the underground media movement prevalent in conservative Australian culture in the mid-20th century.

item.title: Global financial system hangs in balance as Federal Reserve independence challenged
item.description: A criminal probe into the US Federal Reserve chair threatens to undermine the US dollar and the global monetary system. Local analysts warn the implications for Australia are profound.

item.title: Adelaide Writers' Week director Louise Adler resigns following Randa Abdel-Fattah's removal
item.description: The director of Adelaide Writers' Week resigns after days of furore regarding a decision to cancel a scheduled appearance by a Palestinian-Australian author.

item.title: Alyssa Healy's path to Australian cricket greatness was far from straightforward
item.description: Alyssa Healy was thrust into headlines when she was just 16 for daring to break into a literal old boys' club, but has expertly handled the national spotlight with bat, ball and microphone in hand.

item.title: Donald Trump says countries doing business with Iran face 25 per cent tariff
item.description: US President Donald Trump takes to social media to announce tariffs, saying they will be "effective immediately".

item.title: Former A-League player Josh Cavallo alleges Adelaide United was homophobic
item.description: Australia's first openly gay male professional footballer, Josh Cavallo, has alleged his former club was homophobic, something it denies.

item.title: Record number of black and grey-headed flying foxes die during east coast heatwave
item.description: Wildlife rescuers warn extreme heat could kill more black and grey-headed flying foxes across NSW, with 700 dead animals already removed from two Illawarra camps.

item.title: Minnesota and the Twin Cities sue US federal government to stop immigration crackdown
item.description: Minnesota and its two cities sue the Trump administration in a bid to stop an immigration crackdown that led to the fatal shooting of Renee Good last week.

item.title: SA premier becomes emotional in press conference
item.description: Peter Malinauskas becomes tearful during a media conference where he faces extensive questions about the crisis surrounding Adelaide Writers' Week and allegations of homophobia against Adelaide United made by former player Josh Cavallo.

item.title: Rudd leaves US-Australia relationship in good shape ahead of Trump's China visit
item.description: One month after Kevin Rudd leaves his post as Australia's ambassador to Washington, Donald Trump will make his first presidential visit to China in almost 10 years.

item.title: Fears of unseen violence against protesters as Iran's internet blackout enters a fifth day
item.description: Human rights groups estimate more than 500 people have been killed and more than 10,600 arrested in the ongoing protests.

item.title: Mount Alexander fire knocks out TV and radio across central Victoria
item.description: A fast-moving fire has silenced free-to-air TV and radio across central Victoria — and it could take months to fix the site.

item.title: Tasmanian pianist takes outdoor performances to striking mainland locations
item.description: Kelvin Smith played a baby grand piano at some incredible sites across Tasmania before bringing his impromptu shows to amazing mainland locations.

item.title: Retired US Navy captain Mark Kelly sues the Pentagon over demotion threats
item.description: The US Democratic senator alleges the president and defense secretary are trying to intimidate him into silence for comments he made in a video calling on serving troops to defy illegal orders.

item.title: Adelaide Writers' Week cancelled amid controversy over disinvitation of author Randa Abdel-Fattah
item.description: The remaining members of the Adelaide Festival board will step down and this year's Writers' Week event has been cancelled, after days of furore regarding the decision to cancel a scheduled appearance by Palestinian Australian author Randa Abdel-Fattah.

item.title: l decluttered my wardrobe and said goodbye to 'fantasy me'
item.description: I was tired of trying to live up to an idealised version of myself. So, I decided to do something I had learnt from Marie Kondo: sort my wardrobe into what brought me joy and what didn't.

item.title: Koala captured on motion-sensor camera in rare sighting near Canberra
item.description: A motion-sensor camera has captured the rare sight of a koala in the wild at a wildlife sanctuary in Googong near the ACT border.

item.title: Iranian Australians wary of foreign intervention or regime change amid fear for relatives
item.description: Some members of the Iranian diaspora in Australia are wary of foreign intervention in Iran, but others say there may not be another choice.

item.title: Carnarvon growers enjoy massive mango season, bringing prices down for consumers
item.description: A WA mango grower is pleasantly surprised to find a crop full of massive mangoes, as big as a bowling ball.

item.title: Australian Open qualifying: Cruz Hewitt knocked out in first round, Storm Hunter returns with a win
item.description: It is the second year in a row Hewitt has been knocked out in the first round of qualifying, but the match against a much higher-ranked opponent can only do good things for him.

item.title: Neo-Nazi group National Socialist Network says it will disband due to proposed hate speech laws
item.description: In a statement posted to Telegram, the group announced the closure of the National Socialist Network would also spell the end of "co-projects" White Australia, the European Australian Movement and the White Australia Party.

item.title: Venus Williams exits Hobart International after straight-sets loss to Tatjana Maria
item.description: After being awarded a wildcard at the age of 45, seven-time major singles champion Venus Williams falls in the opening round in Hobart.

item.title: Ruffy community determined to rebuild after Longwood bushfire destroys Victorian town
item.description: Residents in the central Victorian community of Ruffy say they are determined to rebuild after a bushfire destroyed most buildings in the small community.

item.title: Sydney Festival show asses.masses combines participatory theatre and the social fabric of playing video games together
item.description: Theatre makers Patrick Blenkarn and Milton Lim have built a game to be played socially in an auditorium, with a single player leading a group of donkeys on a journey of discovery.

item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: More than 500 structures lost as Victoria continues to reel from devastating bushfires
item.description: Communities around Victoria continue to count the cost of devastating bushfires, with more than 500 structures — including 179 homes — lost or damaged so far.

item.title: Maya Joint defeats former Australian Open champion Sofia Kenin at Adelaide International
item.description: Maya Joint breaks through for her first win of the season to set up an all-Australian second-round showdown against Ajla Tomljanović at the Adelaide International.

item.title: Public transport bypassed in Labor's Mount Barker re-election promises
item.description: Labor today announced a $200 million investment in Mount Barker as part of its bid to win the seat of Kavel, but while some of those initiatives have been welcomed, there was a glaring omission in public transport solutions.

item.title: Liberals divided over Labor's plan to outlaw inciting racial hatred
item.description: After weeks criticising the Albanese government over the Bondi attack and issues around antisemitism, the Coalition is split over whether proposed solutions are at odds with its interests in preserving freedom of speech.

item.title: Former Adelaide Writers' Week director Louise Adler attacks government and lobby groups over censorship
item.description: The former Adelaide Writers' Week director takes aim at lobby groups and the SA premier during an intense appearance on 7.30 in which she says the event's reputation has been "trashed".

item.title: Russia launches another major attack on Ukraine's power grid, killing four people
item.description: Four people have been killed in the latest strikes by Russia that have mainly targeted the power grid.

item.title: Global financial markets to face major test next week as central bankers support Powell
item.description: Lisa Cook vs the US government will hit the courts next week. The case comes as Australia's Reserve Bank governor, Michele Bullock, signs a letter in support of US Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell, who is facing a criminal investigation in the United States.

item.title: Around 2,500 reportedly killed in protests as Donald Trump tells Iranians 'help is on its way'
item.description: Activists say around 2,500 people have been killed in protests against the country's ruling Islamic regime.

item.title: Clintons refuse to testify for US House Epstein investigation
item.description: Republicans in the US House say they could commence contempt of Congress proceedings against the former president and former Democratic presidential nominee.

item.title: Prosecutors seek death penalty for Yoon Suk Yeol in South Korea after martial law call
item.description: Yoon Suk Yeol faces several criminal charges related to his call to impose martial law and other criminal cases related to his time in office.

item.title: Victoria's bushfires more than five times the size of Singapore
item.description: Victoria's bushfires have now burnt across 404,000 hectares, or a total area more than five times the size of Singapore.

item.title: Documents reveal tensions over Kunanyi/Mt Wellington access plans debate
item.description: Loved by bushwalkers and tourists, a sacred Aboriginal site, and with weather conditions that can quickly deteriorate, Hobart's Kunanyi/Mount Wellington is a challenge to manage — and a government review of how that is done is being met with concerns.

item.title: Rare verified footage of Iran's protests posted online shows how the movement started and how it is growing
item.description: The first embers of the Iranian protests started in a mobile phone market, spreading to every corner of the country as the Revolutionary Guard struggled to regain control.

item.title: Russia's nuclear-capable hypersonic Oreshnik missile a new NATO dilemma
item.description: Analysts say Russia's new Oreshnik hypersonic missile will continues to pose challenges for NATO after Moscow used the weapon for a second time in Ukraine.

item.title: Natimuk praised for 'heroic' response to fast-moving fire that claimed 30 homes
item.description: The Natimuk community counts its losses after fire tears through the region, destroying properties, businesses and about 30 homes.

item.title: Racism targeting migrant truck drivers rampant amid regulatory gaps
item.description: Some Indian truck drivers have copped so much racist abuse they have stopped using their CB radios.

item.title: A tearful premier and 'Moscow on the Torrens': How to lose a writers' week in six days
item.description: The removal and subsequent handling of Randa Abdel-Fattah's rescinded invitation to Adelaide Writers' Week led to the event's cancellation, with more than 180 authors pulling out and its own director issuing a pointed and very public resignation. Where does the festival go from here?

item.description: With the 2026 Australian Open just around the corner here's everything you need to know about the tournament.

item.description: The ABC can reveal a neurosurgeon specialising in spinal surgery is among five people facing serious charges over a Queensland scheme allegedly involving kickbacks for medical devices.

item.title: Floral tributes from Bondi Beach attack to be permanently memorialised by Sydney Jewish Museum
item.description: Volunteers came together to make something incredible happen — to preserve flowers, handpainted stones, teddies, cards and victim's items from the scene of the Bondi Beach terrorist attack for a commemorative artwork.

item.description: Residents in low-lying areas surrounding the Mackenzie River are being warned to leave now due to dangerous flooding.

item.description: The chihuahua-cross was rescued by Vinnies volunteers who named the puppy "Vinnie". The charity says it is rare but unfortunately not unheard of for live animals to be donated.

item.title: Delcy Rodríguez balances Trump's demands amid military-backed coalition
item.description: Venezuela is in the hands of both Donald Trump and a regime loyal to its ousted leader. The country's future, including the well-being of its people, is likely to depend on how well Delcy Rodríguez can walk a tightrope between Washington's demands and her coalition's hardliners.

item.title: Aleksandar Vukic beats Stefanos Tsitsipas to reach Adelaide International last 16 alongside Rinky Hijikata
item.description: Australians Aleksandar Vukic and Rinky Hijikata join Thanasi Kokkinakis in the men's last 16 in Adelaide, while Stefanos Tstisipas slide continues.

item.title: ASX flat, Trump savages 'jerk' Powell and Iran has oil traders betting on global chaos — as it happened
item.description: The Australian share market flattens after a Wall Street retreat from record highs while global central bank chiefs, including RBA governor Michele Bullock, issue a joint statement backing US Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell, who is under criminal investigation.

item.title: SailGP hits Fremantle for first time as high-speed boat racing season kicks off
item.description: The eyes of the sailing world will be on Perth's port city of Fremantle this weekend as it welcomes the high-speed, big-money international Sail Grand Prix for the first time.

item.title: Dilbert cartoon creator Scott Adams has died, aged 68
item.description: At its height, Dilbert was syndicated around the world, delighting people with its satirical take on office work before creator Scott Adams began a descent into racism and misogyny.

item.description: Hundreds of people were evacuated from an area near Wharton Beach on Western Australia's south coast in the early hours of New Year's Day after a blaze broke out.

item.title: Randa Abdel-Fattah says lawyers have threatened defamation proceedings against Peter Malinauskas
item.description: Palestinian Australian author Randa Abdel-Fattah says her lawyers have threatened defamation proceedings against South Australian Premier Peter Malinauskas following his public commentary about her scheduled appearance at Adelaide Writers' Week.

item.title: Tom Silvagni files application to appeal rape conviction

item.title: Carranaballac Cricket Club reduced to ashes after fire in western Victorian community of Streatham
item.description: Leigh Graham lost his home and his "second home" — his local cricket club's rooms — in the fires that moved through the western Victorian community of Streatham. He still turned up to play two days later.

item.description: The K-pop supergroup announce their first Australian tour dates since being discharged from the South Korean military.

item.title: Former NRLW Blues captain Maddison Studdon facing domestic violence charge
item.description: Maddison Studdon is accused of harassing her ex-partner as their relationship broke down, culminating in 29 calls and an alleged "throat-slitting" gesture over cheating claims.

item.title: There is now a strong likelihood Donald Trump will order his military option of choice on Iran
item.description: The Iranian regime has done exactly what Donald Trump warned against. Despite the information blackout, it is clear hundreds, if not thousands, of protesters have died and the US president is now likely to order a response, writes John Lyons.

item.description: Researchers are asking for the public's help to learn more about the health of the albino whale, which was seen from Crescent Head on the Mid North Coast.

item.description: Bernard Tomic was brushed past by Britain's Arthur Fery in their second round match, while Olivia Gadecki was beaten by Sloane Stephens.

item.title: Publishers, bookstores pull Craig Silvey's work in response to child exploitation material charges
item.description: The fallout of the high-profile child exploitation material allegations against Craig Silvey starts to ripple through the literary community, as the renowned author faces charges of possessing and distributing illicit material.

item.title: Our changing climate in 2025 in pictures and graphs as Australia kicks off year with extreme heat, fires
item.description: Extreme heat, droughts, storms and deadly floods challenged resilience not only in Australia, but across the globe.

item.title: These were the most-borrowed books from Brisbane libraries in 2025
item.description: New data has revealed there were 5.9 million physical items — including books, CDs and DVDs — checked out of Brisbane libraries in 2025.

item.title: Socceroos midfielder Jackson Irvine ruled out 'until further notice' with recurrence of foot injury
item.description: Socceroos midfielder Jackson Irvine is facing an extended stint on the sidelines heading into this year's World Cup.

item.title: Pilbara home to five animal species most impacted by habitat loss, report finds
item.description: The Australian Conservation Foundation says tens of thousands of hectares of land were approved for clearing last year, double that of 2024, putting already endangered species at further risk.

item.title: Farmers hurt by Victorian fires to receive $50m state and federal support package
item.description: The Allan government says it will provide grants and loans to support farmers who have lost homes, livestock, infrastructure and feed in the Victorian fires.

item.title: Man hoarding footballs convicted of dangerous driving and fined after years-long 'pranking' by kids
item.description: A Tasmanian man who had "had enough" after becoming the target of "pranks" by kids, had hoarded "hundreds" of footballs kicked into his yard from the neighbouring school, a court hears.

item.title: Prayer hall linked to notorious preacher Wisam Haddad to close permanently
item.description: A controversial prayer hall in south-west Sydney linked to notorious Islamic preacher Wisam Haddad has announced it will permanently close.

item.title: Greens slam the Tasmanian government over minister's 'messaging' on gun reforms
item.description: The Tasmanian government has not settled on a position on a national gun buyback scheme proposed in the wake of the Bondi terror attack. The Tasmanian Greens say the "messaging" from the state's police minister is "appalling".

item.title: China reports $US1.2 trillion trade surplus in 2025 despite Trump trade war
item.description: A shift away from the United States toward South-East Asia, Africa and Latin America has helped Chinese exports remain strong.

item.title: At least 32 killed after crane falls on passenger train in Thailand
item.description: A crane used to construct an elevated high-speed railway has fallen onto a moving train travelling from Bangkok to Ubon Ratchathani province, officials say.

item.title: New project at old Port Augusta power station site to create 150 jobs and 'green cement'
item.description: About 150 jobs will be created by a new "green cement" project at a power station site which has sat vacant for nearly a decade, the SA government says.

item.title: At least 19 killed after crane falls on train in Thailand's north-east

item.title: Peak Jewish group urges Labor to 'get rid' of hate exemption for religious texts
item.description: Representatives of the Jewish community and Australian National Imams Council front a snap parliamentary hearing called to probe Labor's legislative response to the Bondi terror attack.

item.title: 'Significant' theft of toxic poppies could cause death, Tasmanian authorities warn
item.description: The theft of a "significant quantity" of medicinal-grade poppies could result in a "life-threatening" situation if they are ingested in pursuit of a high, Tasmanian authorities warn.

item.title: US needs Greenland for purpose of national security, says Trump ahead of talks
item.description: Greenlandic and Danish foreign ministers will meet US Vice-President JD Vance and Secretary of State Marco Rubio in Washington after the US renews threats to take control of the Arctic island.

item.title: Taylah Preston makes Hobart International quarterfinals after upset win over Rebecca Sramkova
item.description: The 20-year-old world number 204, who also has a wildcard at the upcoming Australian Open, won the match against the world number 72 6-4, 6-1.

item.title: Alyssa Healy taken aback by reaction to commentary stints as post-retirement career seems assured
item.description: After calling time on her decorated 15-year career, a spell in media commentary looks inevitable for Australian cricket star Alyssa Healy.

item.title: Police search for $140k boat stolen from Mooloolaba
item.description: Police search for a boat worth about $140,000 that was stolen from the Sunshine Coast after its keys were left on board while the owners were overseas on holiday.

item.title: Adelaide United says Josh Cavallo never raised homophobia concerns with A-League club
item.description: The head of Adelaide United says the former Reds player Josh Cavallo never raised concerns about homophobia or not being selected to play based on his sexuality while at the A-League club.

item.title: Central Queensland graziers share livestock survival stories amid flood devastation
item.description: Amid the damage from flooding in Central Queensland, tales of livestock surviving are emerging, including one cow's incredible waterlogged journey.

item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Indonesian fishermen who 'should have known better' jailed after repeat offences in Australian waters
item.description: The men will serve four months in prison after being caught off the WA coast with 40 kilograms of sea cucumber and an array of fishing gear.

item.title: Geraldton windsurfer Sarah Kenyon crowned U18 junior world champion
item.description: Geraldton windsurfer Sarah Kenyon is victorious after a tight battle in the sport's junior world championships held in regional WA for the first time.

item.title: Adelaide Writers' Week move prompted 'wildfire' worry in festival director
item.description: As the Adelaide Festival director reveals he had urged the festival's board not to cancel Palestinian Australian author Randa Abdel-Fattah, a former board member opens up about his very different concerns about the Adelaide Writers' Week program.

item.title: Tasmanian commercial fishers warned about potential antibiotic contamination from salmon pens
item.description: Tasmania's Natural Resources and Environment Department has warned commercial fishers that driving their boats near some salmon pens could result in their onboard catch absorbing traces of the antibiotic florfenicol.

item.title: Hackers access names, emails of Victorian students in data breach
item.description: Hackers have accessed the emails, passwords and names of past and present students from all Victorian government schools in a major data breach.

item.title: World title hopes on the line in Tszyu-Zerafa fight in Brisbane
item.description: No Limit boss George Rose says the doorway to the world will open for the winner of the Nikita Tszyu and Michael Zerafa grudge boxing showdown.

item.title: Australia investigating options to assist search for missing diver in Antarctica
item.description: Australian authorities say they are "investigating all the options available" to assist a search operation for a diver missing in Antarctica.

item.title: Tony Burke celebrates Kaz Hamad's arrest as illicit tobacco expert warns it may leave a power vacuum
item.description: Home Affairs Minister Tony Burke says he believes tobacco kingpin Kaz Hamad thought he was "out of reach" of authorities before his arrest in Iraq.

item.title: Iran warns of retaliation as US withdraws troops from Middle East bases
item.description: It comes as Iran's judiciary defied US warnings and said those detained over anti-regime protests could face execution.

item.description: Sydneysider Jordan Smith has beaten grand slam champion Jannik Sinner and dual grand slam finalist Amanda Anasimova to take home the prize in the novelty format.

item.title: Today in history, January 15: Australia's London Bridge fell down
item.description: Kelli Bryers wasn't sure if anyone had seen the London Bridge rock formation collapse just seconds after she and her cousin, David Darrington, had crossed it.

item.title: Can you guess how overdue and over budget these Grand Designs Transformations renovations were?

item.title: Victorians returning to fire-ravaged towns as crews battle bushfires statewide
item.description: More than 228 homes have been confirmed destroyed by bushfires across Victoria, with authorities warning the total is likely to rise.

item.title: Greens deal in play as Coalition backs away from Labor's hate and gun reforms
item.description: Liberals are backing away from a push to tackle antisemitism with stronger racial hatred laws, with some senior figures in the party also voicing freedom of speech concerns.

item.title: Ukraine's former PM Yulia Tymoshenko, formerly a rival to Volodymyr Zelenskyy, facing allegations of bribery
item.description: Anti-corruption watchdogs in Ukraine have searched the offices of the country's former prime minister Yulia Tymoshenko amid allegations of a major bribery scheme.

item.title: Who to see at Tamworth Country Music Festival 2026 — top artists and event details
item.description: Discover the must-see artists at the 2026 Tamworth Country Music Festival — from breakout stars like Lane Pittman to legends such as Felicity Urquhart. Your ultimate guide to shows, dates, and insider tips.

item.title: From inside Iran, a young protester says the people 'are waiting for America to intervene'
item.description: A defiant voice bravely breaks through Iran's internet blackout to detail the horrors she has witnessed and to tell the president of the United States "the people are waiting for America to intervene".

item.title: Severe thunderstorms and flooding to hit eastern seaboard in weather switch-up
item.description: Severe thunderstorms and flooding rain are expected to ease the short-term fire threat, while Queensland continues to be drenched from ex-Tropical Cyclone Koji.

item.title: Rental market growth stalls in some capital cities as household budgets stretched to limit
item.description: Australia's rental market is "starting to rebalance" with prices flat in some capital cities but affordability remains a concern, according to Domain, which says an annual salary of $100,000 is needed to live comfortably.

item.title: Writers' Week cancellation highlights SA Premier's uneasy relationship with the arts
item.description: After backing the Adelaide Festival’s decision to drop a Palestinian Australian author from Writers’ Week, Premier Peter Malinauskas is now trying to distance himself from a crisis that threatens to do untold damage to South Australia’s festival reputation.

item.title: Jafar Panahi is ready to go to prison for the film the Iranian government doesn't want you to see
item.description: Would you face prison for what you believe in? Iranian filmmaker Jafar Panahi already has and, following the release of his latest film, he may again.

item.title: Reopening Gulgong Medical Centre a 'lifeline' for the community
item.description: Gulgong went 18 months without a GP clinic. It has now reopened, giving residents a reprieve from travelling hundreds of kilometres to see a doctor.

item.title: Controversial group Hizb ut-Tahrir says it 'cannot be banned' despite proposed laws targeting hate speech
item.description: Controversial group Hizb ut-Tahrir says the government "cannot ban" its ideas despite its members facing the threat of jail time under proposed hate speech laws to go before parliament.

item.title: Trauma medics warn over-60s against climbing ladders as 6,000 people hospitalised in a year
item.description: Thousands of people present to Australian hospitals each year for ladder and roof falls, with doctors urging caution — particularly for ageing Australians.

item.title: Trump to write next chapter of US relations with Iran after decades of tensions
item.description: From a CIA-led coup to a hostage crisis and air strikes, here are some of the defining moments in seven decades of relations between the US and Iran.

item.title: Tree bark microbes play a role in eliminating greenhouse gases, study finds
item.description: Tiny, gas-eating microbes hidden in the bark of trees offer scientists a crucial clue in the fight against global warming.

item.title: Denmark fundamentally disagrees with US owning Greenland
item.description: The United States and Denmark continue to disagree over the future of Greenland after a meeting at the White House amid ongoing threats from President Donald Trump threatening to seize the semi-autonomous Danish territory for national security reasons.

item.description: Communities in Queensland's central highlands region remain on high alert today as major flooding continues along the Mackenzie River.

item.title: Victorian families warn of risks after hiring au pairs through social media
item.description: Families who turned to social media to find an au pair say the lack of safeguards left them vulnerable to serious problems.

item.title: NT set to fall short of Indigenous law and justice target despite early success
item.description: Despite the NT government signing on to establish 20 Aboriginal Law and Justice Groups by 2027, just five are up and running with less than 12 months to go.

item.title: Daniel Sanders suffers broken collarbone in Dakar Rally crash, losing lead but vows to ride on
item.description: Daniel Sanders says he has broken his collarbone and sternum in a crash on stage 10 of the Dakar Rally, but vows to finish the last three stages.
